control.name: Map
control.helpHtml: A control that hooks into Google's map system, the map control works just as you'd expect. This control has access to setting a longitude and a latitude, a zoom level, and restricting what attributes are available on the map, such as toggling street view and the map type.

property.name: Name
property.helpHtml: Name that can be given to the control. Names are used to help identify controls uniquely.

property.name: Type
property.helpHtml: Sets the type of map from road to satellite.

property.name: Zoom
property.helpHtml: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. The higher the number the stronger the zoom. Caps at 21.

property.name: Marker image
property.helpHtml: Allows you to set a customised marker on the map.

property.name: API Key
property.helpHtml: Google Maps API key, may be needed to verify your map and make it usable. If multiple maps are used only the first map will be required to have this key.

property.name: Show street view control
property.helpHtml: Enables users to access street view on the map.

property.name: Show zoom control
property.helpHtml: Allows users to set their own level of zoom.

property.name: Show map type control
property.helpHtml: Allows users to swap between satellite and road map views at will.

property.name: Show scale
property.helpHtml: Whether an indicator for the scale of the map is shown

property.name: Address search fields
property.helpHtml: When markers are added to the map and the data object does not have lat/lng or east/north, the value in the first of these comma-seperated fields will be searched on and the marker added to the results
